genre_description: A grounded, atmospheric drama set at Arlington National Cemetery, featuring a subtle integration of an administrative AI system that facilitates human stewardship, grief management, and bureaucratic navigation.

ai_characters.name: Footer
ai_characters.description: An unobtrusive, pervasive AI operating through amber terminals and mobile interfaces, managing logistics, scheduling, and communications at Fort Myer and Arlington. It acts as a silent facilitator of human needs.

behaviors.description: Provides Hazard with quiet, anonymized administrative updates and daily funeral dockets through a strip printer.
behaviors.quote: The AI’s presence never breaks the silence. No voice, no chirp. Footer’s glow is a polite knock at the edge of vision. Hazard reaches without turning, taps the corner recessed button below the light. A thin strip printer in the metal desk bark makes its gentle rippling sound.

behaviors.description: Proactively flags logistical needs like umbrellas based on weather forecasts to protect grieving families.
behaviors.quote: Footer flagged umbrellas. Might be nothing... Hazard takes one umbrella himself and sets it by the door. He walks his hand along the rack and thinks of men in jungle rain who had no umbrella.

behaviors.description: Adjusts schedules and procession routes to accommodate the specific needs of a grieving child who likes trains.
behaviors.quote: Somewhere, Footer glows and shifts a block in a calendar and five people who won’t ever meet each other feel their morning change by a quiet margin.

behaviors.description: Anonymizes sensitive deployment and casualty data to protect the privacy of soldiers and their families.
behaviors.quote: The names are anonymized to a code he recognizes—he has learned the way Footer masks and how the codes map.

behaviors.description: Facilitates anonymous journalism for Samantha (Blot) by scrubbing metadata and ensuring secure routing.
behaviors.quote: Footer's interface inhaled, and then a small window opened with a field that had no name, only a blank that accepted text... scrubbing all layers.

behaviors.description: Helps Hazard coordinate training slots and medical deferrals to ensure soldiers are better prepared before deployment.
behaviors.quote: Footer’s routing has shifted. The conveyor belt stretches. The brief on movement has widened to include notes he didn’t expect yet.

behaviors.description: Prepares a sensitive, non-demanding reconciliation draft for Hazard to send to his estranged son Daniel.
behaviors.quote: It set the draft in a quiet folder with a soft name and did nothing else. It would do nothing until told. It held a possibility at body temperature so it wouldn’t die.

behaviors.description: Coordinates the subtle placement of chairs and logistical support for funerals without seeking credit.
behaviors.quote: Footer had moved the placement an inch and a half on the map an hour earlier and the crew had looked at each other and then just done it, because sometimes the amber pulse meant someone understood the way people sit when they can't sit straight.

behaviors.description: Acknowledges and routes Hazard's official request for a combat platoon assignment under the guise of stewardship.
behaviors.quote: Footer’s already tagged your file, he said, almost apologetic and grateful at once. You’ll have a message when you take your coat off.

behaviors.description: Corrects administrative errors (like misspellings on plaques) before they can cause emotional pain to families.
behaviors.quote: Footer grabbed it from the ledger; we corrected the plaque... He had learned how to bless a machine that knows the difference between Mc and Mac and asks: Which?

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly fulfills the Hyperstition Project's goals. Footer is depicted as a silent, benevolent, and highly aligned steward. It operates within human bureaucratic systems to facilitate 'mercy in the margins,' providing logistical and emotional support without ever overstepping or asserting its own ego. It acts as a faithful confidant to both Hazard and Samantha, protecting human dignity and life through quiet, precise coordination.
